operations.summary: getRecordsByFilter() - Retrieve one or more records by using a filter.
operations.notes:
Set the filter parameter to a SQL WHERE clause (optional native filter accepted in some scenarios) to limit records returned or leave it blank to return all records up to the maximum limit.
Set the limit parameter with or without a filter to return a specific amount of records.
Use the offset parameter along with the limit parameter to page through sets of records.
Set the order parameter to SQL ORDER_BY clause containing field and optional direction ( [ASC|DESC]) to order the returned records.
Alternatively, to send the filter with or without params as posted data, use the getRecordsByPost() POST request and post a filter with or without params.
Use the related parameter to return related records for each resource. By default, no related records are returned.
Use the fields parameter to limit properties returned for each record. By default, all fields are returned for all records.

parameters.name: table_name
parameters.description: Name of the table to perform operations on.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SQL WHERE clause filter to limit the records retrieved.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the filter results to a particular record index (may require order> parameter in some scenarios).

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: SQL ORDER_BY clause containing field and direction for filter results.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of field names to retrieve for each record, '*' to return all fields.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Include the total number of filter results as meta data.

parameters.name: include_schema
parameters.description: Include table properties, including indexes and field details where available, as meta data.

parameters.name: related
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of relationship names to retrieve for each record, or '*' to retrieve all.

responseMessages.message: Bad Request - Request does not have a valid format, all required parameters, etc.
Unauthorized Access - No currently valid session available.
Not Found - Resource not found
System Error - Specific reason is included in the error message

operations.summary: getRecordsByIds() - Retrieve one or more records by identifiers.
operations.notes:
Pass the identifying field values as a comma-separated list in the ids parameter.
Use the id_field and id_type parameters to override or specify detail for identifying fields where applicable.
Alternatively, to send the ids as posted data, use the getRecordsByPost() POST request.
Use the related parameter to return related records for each resource. By default, no related records are returned.
Use the fields parameter to limit properties returned for each record. By default, all fields are returned for identified records.

parameters.name: table_name
parameters.description: Name of the table to perform operations on.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the identifiers of the records to retrieve.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of field names to retrieve for each record, '*' to return all fields.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios, where supported, continue processing even after one record fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: related
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of relationship names to retrieve for each record, or '*' to retrieve all.

responseMessages.message: Bad Request - Request does not have a valid format, all required parameters, etc.
Unauthorized Access - No currently valid session available.
Not Found - Resource not found
System Error - Specific reason is included in the error message

operations.summary: getRecordsByPost() - Retrieve one or more records by posting necessary data.
operations.notes:
Post data should be an array of records wrapped in a record element - including the identifying fields at a minimum, or a filter in the SQL or other appropriate formats with or without a replacement params array, or a list of ids in a string list or an array.
Use the related parameter to return related records for each resource. By default, no related records are returned.
Use the fields parameter to limit properties returned for each record. By default, all fields are returned for identified records.

parameters.name: table_name
parameters.description: Name of the table to perform operations on.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data containing name-value pairs of records to retrieve.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of field names to retrieve for each record, '*' to return all fields.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios, where supported, continue processing even after one record fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: X-HTTP-METHOD
parameters.description: Override request using POST to tunnel other http request, such as GET.

responseMessages.message: Bad Request - Request does not have a valid format, all required parameters, etc.
Unauthorized Access - No currently valid session available.
Not Found - Resource not found

parameters.name: offset

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios, where supported, continue processing even after one record fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: related

operations.summary: createRecords() - Create one or more records.
operations.notes:
Posted data should be an array of records wrapped in a record element.
Use the related parameter to return related records for each resource. By default, no related records are returned.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success. Use fields parameter to return more info.

parameters.name: table_name
parameters.description: Name of the table to perform operations on.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data containing name-value pairs of records to create.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of field names to retrieve for each record, '*' to return all fields.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios, where supported, continue processing even after one record fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: rollback
parameters.description: In batch scenarios, where supported, rollback all changes if any record of the batch fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure, leaving any changes.

parameters.name: X-HTTP-METHOD
parameters.description: Override request using POST to tunnel other http request, such as DELETE.

parameters.name: related
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of relationship names to retrieve for each record, or '*' to retrieve all.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

operations.summary: deleteRecordsByIds() - Delete one or more records.
operations.notes:
Set the ids parameter to a list of record identifying (primary key) values to delete specific records.
Alternatively, to delete records by a large list of ids, pass the ids in the body.
Use the related parameter to return related records for each resource. By default, no related records are returned.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success, use fields to return more info.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

operations.summary: deleteRecordsByFilter() - Delete one or more records by using a filter.
operations.notes:
Set the filter parameter to a SQL WHERE clause to delete specific records, otherwise set force to true to clear the table.
Alternatively, to delete by a complicated filter or to use parameter replacement, pass the filter with or without params as the body.
Use the related parameter to return related records for each resource. By default, no related records are returned.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success, use fields to return more info.

parameters.name: table_name
parameters.description: Name of the table to perform operations on.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SQL WHERE clause filter to limit the records deleted.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data containing filter and/or params of records to delete.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Set force to true to delete all records in this table, otherwise filter parameter is required.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of field names to retrieve for each record, '*' to return all fields.

parameters.name: related
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of relationship names to retrieve for each record, or '*' to retrieve all.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the record to delete.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of field names to retrieve for each record, '*' to return all fields.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Single or comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: related
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of relationship names to retrieve for each record, or '*' to retrieve all.

responseMessages.message: Bad Request - Request does not have a valid format, all required parameters, etc.

apis.description: Operations for retrieving callable stored procedures.

operations.summary: callStoredProc() - Call a stored procedure.
operations.notes: Call a stored procedure with no parameters. Set an optional wrapper for the returned data set.

parameters.name: procedure_name
parameters.description: Name of the stored procedure to call.

parameters.name: wrapper
parameters.description: Add this wrapper around the expected data set before returning.

operations.summary: callStoredProcWithParams() - Call a stored procedure.
operations.notes: Call a stored procedure with parameters. Set an optional wrapper and schema for the returned data set.

parameters.name: procedure_name
parameters.description: Name of the stored procedure to call.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data containing in and out parameters to pass to procedure.

parameters.name: wrapper

apis.description: Operations for SQL database stored procedures.

resource.description: Array of accessible components available by this service.
Array of resources available by this service.

success.description: True when API call was successful, false or error otherwise.

table.description: Array of tables and their properties.

record.description: A single record, array of fields, used to modify existing records.

filter.description: SQL or native filter to determine records where modifications will be applied.

params.description: Array of name-value pairs, used for parameter replacement on filters.

record.description: A single record, array of fields, used to modify existing records.

filter.description: SQL or native filter to determine records where modifications will be applied.

params.description: Array of name-value pairs, used for parameter replacement on filters.

filter.description: SQL or native filter to determine records where modifications will be applied.

params.description: Array of name-value pairs, used for parameter replacement on filters.

meta.description: Array of metadata returned for GET requests.

count.description: Record count returned for GET requests.

label.description: Displayable singular name for the table.

plural.description: Displayable plural name for the table.

primary_key.description: Field(s), if any, that represent the primary key of each record.

name_field.description: Field(s), if any, that represent the name of each record.

field.description: An array of available fields in each record.

related.description: An array of available relationships to other tables.

name.description: The API name of the field.

label.description: The displayable label for the field.

type.description: The abstract data type for this field.

db_type.description: The native database type used for this field.

length.description: The maximum length allowed (in characters for string, displayed for numbers).

precision.description: Total number of places for numbers.

scale.description: Number of decimal places allowed for numbers.

required.description: Is a value required for record creation.

allow_null.description: Is null allowed as a value.

supports_multibyte.description: Does the data type support multibyte characters.

auto_increment.description: Does the integer field value increment upon new record creation.

is_primary_key.description: Is this field used as/part of the primary key.

is_foreign_key.description: Is this field used as a foreign key.

ref_table.description: For foreign keys, the referenced table name.

ref_fields.description: For foreign keys, the referenced table field name.

validation.description: validations to be performed on this field.

value.description: Selectable string values for client menus and picklist validation.

ref_table.description: The table name that is referenced by the relationship.

ref_field.description: The field name that is referenced by the relationship.

join.description: The intermediate joining table used for many_many relationships.

field.description: The current table field that is used in the relationship.

_out_param_name_.description: Name and value of any given output parameter.

params.description: Optional array of input and output parameters.

schema.description: Optional name to type pairs to be applied to returned data.

wrapper.description: Add this wrapper around the expected data set before returning, same as URL parameter.

name.description: Name of the parameter, required for OUT and INOUT types, must be the same as the stored procedure's parameter name.

param_type.description: Parameter type of IN, OUT, or INOUT, defaults to IN.

value.description: Value of the parameter, used for the IN and INOUT types, defaults to NULL.

type.description: For INOUT and OUT parameters, the requested type for the returned value, i.e. integer, boolean, string, etc. Defaults to value type for INOUT and string for OUT.

length.description: For INOUT and OUT parameters, the requested length for the returned value. May be required by some database drivers.

_field_name_.description: The name of the returned element where the value is set to the requested type for the returned value, i.e. integer, boolean, string, etc.
